Posted By: Totema (4/23/2013 5:39:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Nivmagus Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nivmagus Elemental), meet Trait Doctoring.  
Trait Doctoring, exile yourself and give Nivmagus Elemental two +1/+1 counters for ***FREE*** every turn.  
  
Being able to theoretically win a game with (1) Island and (2) cards is pretty darn efficient. Of course, it probably won't win you a game, but it will put your opponent on the defensive immediately. It's a threat that they will have to either block to prevent it from getting bigger, or remove outright. While they are dealing with that, your other strategies will be able to win you the game.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Too bad the card name [Totally Lost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Totally Lost) was already taken because if you play this, then you will totally lose.  
  
Dimir is my guild and I am saddened by this. Until end of turn? What the heck is one to do with that? Some kind of weird mana fixing, I guess, and it's a rare to boot. They should have made it mythic rare so I wouldn't have to worry about pulling it out of booster packs too often.  
  
I sure hope it combos with something in the 2014 Core Set. Right now it is next to useless in Constructed or Limited. The only good thing I can say about it is that it only costs ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) to cast.
posts.html:

I sure hope it combos with something in the 2014 Core Set. Right now it is next to useless in Constructed or Limited. The only good thing I can say about it is that it only costs to cast.

Posted By: whitecow (4/24/2013 8:30:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Gah, I thought this card was going to be amazing until I read that "Until end of turn"  
  
Seemed like it could be an all-star in my [Sygg, River Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sygg, River Guide) EDH, Islandwalking and proceed to change all of my opponents forests into islands or whatever.  
  
But now it only enables islandwalk on the turn its cast and doesn't do anything lasting. Seems pointless, other than "When a spell is cast" triggers but then you probably should just use [Hands of Binding](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hands of Binding) for a card that actually does something. :/
posts.html:

Posted By: Alter_Boy (4/30/2013 9:36:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I see many many uses for this card...but relatively few in standard...once you get into modern and especially legacy this can become nasty. I still use magical hack in some old decks and always end up wishing I had sleight of mind instead...this effectively gives me both in one sloth...plus cipher as icing on the cake! The downside is that it only hits permanents unlike sleight/hack which can hit spells being played like instants and sorceries...but still very useful....you can maindeck good ol flashfires or boil with this and tailor it to your opponents colors...or if they run some creature that is pro whatever color you can change its protection....or if its pro blue you can change your blockers around to be able to deal with it instead...and therein lies the other fault..sorcery instead of instant like the hack was..3/5.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Could be used for mana fixing, to have one of your basic or shock lands produce mana of your choice until the EoT.  
Use with [Crypt Ghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crypt Ghast) and [Gem of Becoming](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gem of Becoming) to ramp a mostly blue deck with a pure Island mana base.  
Use with [Grave Betrayal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Betrayal) to make green zombies. Don't ask me why.  
It has a lot of uses, just none of them very common. Or useful...

posts.post_content:
First thing I thought of was [Magical Hack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magical Hack), which is an instant and can target any spell, not just permanents, and lasts indefinitely when played on a permanent, which in most ways makes it a strictly worse version (can't even be imprinted on [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter)). Still, with a LOT of work, the card can have its use...  
  
 -4 of the cycle of M12 color hosers ([Celestial Purge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Celestial Purge), [Deathmark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathmark), [Combust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Combust), [Autumn's Veil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Autumn's Veil)) will allow you to use those cards on just about any non-hexproof/shroud coloured permanent   
-The Denizen cycle ([Court Street Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Court Street Denizen), [Sage's Row Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sage's Row Denizen), [Shadow Alley Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shadow Alley Denizen), [Foundry Street Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Foundry Street Denizen), [Ivy Lane Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivy Lane Denizen)) can now trigger off of any coloured creature.  
-[Liliana of the Veil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana of the Veil): Dig up any non-Swamp card  
-Any non-hexproof/shroud per... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
First thing I thought of was Magical Hack, which is an instant and can target any spell, not just permanents, and lasts indefinitely when played on a permanent, which in most ways makes it a strictly worse version (can't even be imprinted on Isochron Scepter). Still, with a LOT of work, the card can have its use...

-4 of the cycle of M12 color hosers (Celestial Purge, Deathmark, Combust, Autumn's Veil) will allow you to use those cards on just about any non-hexproof/shroud coloured permanent
-The Denizen cycle (Court Street Denizen, Sage's Row Denizen, Shadow Alley Denizen, Foundry Street Denizen, Ivy Lane Denizen) can now trigger off of any coloured creature.
-Liliana of the Veil: Dig up any non-Swamp card
-Any non-hexproof/shroud per... (see all)

Posted By: Toquinha1977 (4/28/2013 1:47:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"OK, R&D, we need a rare card for Dimir. You know, the guild that everybody loves, but it really sucked in Gatecrash, co we can fix it now. Any suggestions for Dragon's Maze?"  
"Well, we could give them a nice piece of removal"  
"Nah, we already gave that to Golgari, you know, they only got the best removal in Abrubt Decay, they need Putrefy too."  
"Well, what about giving them some good counterspell?"  
"No, Azorius need the cool counterspell more, you know, they don't have any powerful instants whatsoever. I mean, who cares about life and cards?"  
"I know! Let's give them an effect that nobody cares about, but they can do it EVERY TURN!"  
"Yes, YES!!! THIS IS PERFECT!"  
  
I wish my favourite guild was not Dimir, I really do :(
